Review Date: 2015/01/02
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alejandro González Iñárritu'], 'Producers': ['Anne Ruark', 'Steven Golin', 'Jon Kilik'], 'Starring': ['Brad Pitt', 'Cate Blanchett', 'Gael García Bernal'], 'Studio': ['Paramount']}
Review Text: This is a very compelling story.  There are three separate plots that progress separately which are tense and terrible situations.  The stories are real cliff hangers.  This is a film that will replay in your brain long after you see it. Hang in there with this story because the ending pulls things together.
Review Title: Tense drama
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Starzak', 'Christopher Sadler', 'Jay Grace', 'Lee Wilton', 'Seamus Malone', 'Jean-Philippe Vine', 'Richard Webber', 'Will Becher', 'Mike Mort', 'Dave Osmand'], 'Starring': ['John Sparkes', 'Justin Fletcher', 'Kate Harbour'], 'Studio': ['Aardman Animations']}
These shows are so clever. My little 3 year old grand daughter & I had a grand time watching all the high jinks. The humor, the expressions & grumbled by the characters is most enjoyable. I highly recommend this series for all ages.
Shaun the Sheep Season 1
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Nigel Stafford-Clark'], 'Producers': ['Nigel Stafford-Clark'], 'Starring': ['Gillian Anderson', 'Denis Lawson', 'Charles Dance'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']}
The plot and subplots were interesting and mysterious.  The acting was super! The costumes and setting we're excellent.  Charles D. knows how to craft a good story. PBS does a great job of telling it.
Superb tale.
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Susan Tully', 'Patrick Lau', 'Alan Grint', 'John Greening', 'Charlie Palmer', 'Moira Armstrong', 'Marc Jobst', 'David Tucker', 'Julian Holmes', 'Paul Marcus'], 'Producers': ['Grainne Marmion', 'Sue Hogg'], 'Starring': ['Brendan Coyle', 'Claudia Blakley', 'Dawn French'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']}
If you want to see some positive and mentally healthy entertainment...then enjoy this series. This is a refreshing alternative to some of the poor quality and violent shows of today. I find the way relationships are strengthened by honest communication within the communities of caring people so uplifting. The acting is to quality.
Wonderful entertainment.
Lark Rise to Candleford
Drama
["Following critical acclaim, the residents of Lark Rise and Candleford return to the screen in this warm-hearted adaptation of Flora Thompson's novels. This series sees the arrival of a dashing and elegant stranger in Candleford. Rich, enterprising, worldly and without a wife, James Dowling is a successful businessman with a string of London hotels, and has come to transform Candleford and bring it new prosperity. But not everyone welcomes his entrepreneurial qualities and it isn't long before he is sparring with the spirited, yet suddenly unusually flustered, Dorcas and aggravating the pride of the male Lark Risers with his superior business acumen and somewhat overbearing manner."]
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Susan Tully', 'Patrick Lau', 'Alan Grint', 'John Greening', 'Charlie Palmer', 'Moira Armstrong', 'Marc Jobst', 'David Tucker', 'Julian Holmes', 'Paul Marcus'], 'Producers': ['Grainne Marmion', 'Sue Hogg'], 'Starring': ['Brendan Coyle', 'Claudia Blakley', 'Dawn French']}
Great first class entertainment and I am hooked on the stories. There is wonderful acting, authentic costumes and beautiful setting.
Hooked on the series
The Boy in the Striped Pajamas
Drama, Military and War, Compelling, Sad
['A forbidden friendship forms between Bruno, the son of a Nazi commandant, and Schmuel, a Jewish boy held captive in a concentration camp. Though separated physically by a barbed wire fence, their lives become inescapably intertwined.']
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Sean Penn'], 'Producers': ['David Heyman'], 'Starring': ['Vera Farmiga', 'David Thewlis', 'Rupert Friend']}
The story was a dark reminder of a horrific event in world history. What I found difficult to believe that the border of the camp would be unpatrolled for any length of time for the story to happen as it did.  That said,  it had an interesting and sad twist that I found thought provoking.
Sad but a good reminder.

A very interesting story based on a true event.  Wonderful acting.
Feench Canadian historical film

profile:
User Summary:

- **Content Enjoyment**: This user enjoys engaging, clever, and humorous animated content suitable for children and families, often viewing with their grandchildren. They favor narratives promoting positivity and mental well-being while embracing intriguing and mysterious themes. Their recent interaction indicates a growing appreciation for compelling stories within dramatic contexts, particularly those featuring multiple plots that invoke tension and emotional depth.
  
- **Target Audience**: Engages warmly with content for young children, while also appreciating serious narratives that encourage honest communication and foster community ties.

- **Language Preference**: Prefers English audio and subtitles, consistent with their enjoyment of content in their primary language.

- **Quality Rating**: Generally rates media highly, averaging around 4.8, yet recently displayed critical engagement by rating a tense, dramatic film 4.0 for its compelling story, while highlighting its narrative complexity and lasting impact.

- **Studio Affinity**: Shows a preference for reputable studios known for immersive storytelling and character depth, aligning with their taste for both animated and serious narratives that provoke thought.

- **Recommendation Tendency**: Tends to recommend family-friendly shows with broad appeal while remaining open to serious themes that inspire reflection and connection across generations.

Overall, this user values humor, quality storytelling, and content that fosters family interactions while becoming increasingly receptive to narratives that explore deeper life lessons and emotional intricacies.
